p: In contrast, there was an inverse susceptibility pattern of the insect species to the synthetic insecticide indoxacarb; its LC 50 for A. gemmatalis was 0.08 µL a.i./mL, while for S. frugiperda it was 0.003 µL a.i./mL (for the Cry1A.105 and Cry2Ab susceptible strain) and 0.005 µL a.i./mL (for the Cry1A.105 and Cry2Ab resistant strain). Based on these LC 50 estimates, S. frugiperda was less tolerant to indoxacarb than A. gemmatalis (i.e., TR 50 ranged from 16.0 to 26.7-fold) (Table 2). Nonetheless, the essential oil toxicity was lower than that of indoxacarb (approximately 3.5-fold for A. gemmatalis and between 104.0 and to 379.5-fold for S. frugiperda).
